title: Contexts can be Cheap: Solving Stochastic Contextual Bandits with Linear Bandit Algorithms. (arXiv:2211.05632v2 [stat.ML] UPDATED)
abstract: In this paper, we address the stochastic contextual linear bandit problem, where a decision maker is provided a context (a random set of actions drawn from a distribution). The expected reward of each action is specified by the inner product of the action and an unknown parameter. The goal is to design an algorithm that learns to play as close as possible to the unknown optimal policy after a number of action plays. This problem is considered more challenging than the linear bandit problem, which can be viewed as a contextual bandit problem with a \emph{fixed} context. Surprisingly, in this paper, we show that the stochastic contextual problem can be solved as if it is a linear bandit problem. In particular, we establish a novel reduction framework that converts every stochastic contextual linear bandit instance to a linear bandit instance, when the context distribution is known. tldr: 本文解决了随机背景下的上下文线性赌博机问题，并建立了一种算法来解决这个问题。作者通过建立一个新颖的降维框架，将每个随机背景下的上下文线性赌博机实例转换为线性赌博机实例，解决了这个问题。
en_tdlr: This paper addresses the stochastic contextual linear bandit problem and establishes an algorithm to solve it. The authors show that this problem can be solved as if it is a linear bandit problem by establishing a novel reduction framework that converts every stochastic contextual linear bandit instance to a linear bandit instance.
